page.title: 09Tutbury Mill
page.content: The Mill is owned by Courtaulds, a Public Limited Company, and manufactures cotton,man-made fibres and blends in a full range of counts i.e. thickness.It was built in stone by Arkwright in 1786 and is still in production 200 years later but is now powered by electicity instead of water. The raw materials, spun single yarn,is brought by road to this Doubling Mill where the yarn is plied or twisted together into threads.These are sold for sewing threads,tapes,cotton socks, underpants,threads in knitted sweaters and jumpers sold in the High Street stores and the white stripe in men's pin-striped suits.Eight tonnes is produced each week,some being exported. Headed by a manager and his assistant, there are 60 people employed at the Mill,half men and half women,most of whom live locally.
